column2: :chart_with_upwards_trend: Visualise the module tree of browserify project bundles and track down bloat.

Merge pull request #34 from mathisonian/patch-1

update README

update README to 

Thanks for the library - it's been very useful!

I hit the same problem as #24, #30. Using a full path for the browserify input fixed it for me, as well as for other people in those issue threads.
file-tree@^1.0.0

swap icons to more closely match originals

Previously the "size" icon had circles of multiple sizes. This
switches the current icons such that the same applies :)
add "npm test" command

Merge pull request #26 from tmcw/tests

Add tests

Merge pull request #27 from tmcw/svg-icon

Remove images, replace with d3 icons

Merge pull request #25 from tmcw/remove-dead-code

Remove dead code and remove unused 'resolve' dependency

Remove images, replace with d3 icons

This will make it a bit easier to add a new 'icon' for the
new mode I'm working on, and it has the perk of making icons
hidpi-friendly

Add tests

This also caught a minor bug around error handling: this is masked
by the bin, which throws as soon as the callback returns an error,
but using .json programmatically will trigger a bug in which the
function continues and tries to process the return value of the callback
as a module.
Remove dead code and remove unused 'resolve' dependency
use uglify-js, not uglifyjs

Merge pull request #19 from mantoni/master

Use browser-unpack from npm

Merge pull request #21 from mikolalysenko/master

upgrade uniq to 1.0.0
upgrade uniq to 1.0.0, use semver
Use browser-unpack from npm

Merge pull request #15 from bjoerge/master

Move opener to devDependencies
Move opener from devDependencies to dependencies

Show module version numbers

Where possible, disc will now attempt to pull version numbers
from a module's package.json file (if it exists and is valid),
appending the result to the module's name.

Closes #13

Re-introduce the --open CLI flag.

Until node-bcat or an equivalent tool supports piping in HTML pages,
this provides a quick and easy means for just opening disc straight
away and seeing the results.

See also: #12

Display "file size" by default.

This is generally the preferred view of the data and makes
a more sensible default.

Have also added a "mode" option for switching the default
view: mostly because the demo looks nicer on first glance
using the previous one :)

Fixes #14.

Use -h flag with bcat in the docs

This will force bcat to send HTML headers, just in
case it's not recognised :)

Merge branch '1.0'

Conflicts:
	README.md
	bin/discify
	index.js

Readying disc 1.0.0

* Parses bundles directly using browser-unpack.
* Palettes now have names.
* Streaming sugar API now available.
* Removed --open flag.
* Removed --transform flag.
* Added the "browserify core" palette.
* Added the "file types" palette.
* Updated rework, using autoprefixer for prefixing.
tweaks
1.0.0 work-in-progress
Expose extensions option
Use plural opts.transforms to match docs
Flattr button, for pennies
check for null in `toarray`

Merge pull request #8 from chrisdickinson/master

expose --noparse + -n options
expose --noparse + -n options
fix typo
Include prelude.js in output (#7)
Include Buffer in builtins too
Update documentation

Check for `process`, give builtins a pretend directory.

Stats are now a bit closer to actual bundle size (#7)

Refactoring and adding colour schemes.

They don't have a huge amount to offer right now, but should
hopefully be able to introduce a couple more when there's
more metrics to compare.

* "pastel" is just more of the same.
* "highlights" will colour `node_modules` folders green and `lib`
  folders orange, so it's easier to pick out what's specific to
  different modules (#4).
README.md fixes
remove unused dependency (detective)
Enable specific colours for folders/filenames (#4)
Include browserify builtin modules. Closes #3
fix --output flag in discify
Use "browser-builtins" to check for core modules (#3)
